title: As Paul O’Neill’s No. 21 Is Retired, One Last Kick of a Water Cooler

title: Usyk’s Heavyweight Win Sets Up Fury Showdown or More Boxing Messiness
abstract: Oleksandr Usyk beat Anthony Joshua and dedicated his fight to Ukraine, his home country at war with Russia. He wants to fight Tyson Fury, who looms as a retired champion with unclear plans.

abstract: After avoiding a sweep against Alek Manoah and Toronto, the Yankees are scheduled to face the Mets’ Max Scherzer and possibly Jacob deGrom.

title: On Sports and Fame
abstract: A fighter who survived a murder attempt. A pitcher who dazzled and then disappeared. A woman who went viral at the Super Bowl. Seven short stories about fame, in all its forms.
byline: Produced by Alice Fang, Elijah Walker and Ege Uz

title: Tom Weiskopf, British Open Winner and Golf Course Designer, Dies at 79
abstract: A four-time runner-up at the Masters, he won 16 PGA Tour events starting in the late 1960s and later became a television commentator.

multimedia.caption: Tom Weiskopf in 1973 after winning the British Open at the Royal Troon Golf Club in Scotland. It was his only victory in a major tournament.
Tom Weiskopf in 1973 after winning the British Open at the Royal Troon Golf Club in Scotland. It was his only victory in a major tournament.
Tom Weiskopf in 1973 after winning the British Open at the Royal Troon Golf Club in Scotland. It was his only victory in a major tournament.

title: Deshaun Watson’s Apology Undercuts the N.F.L.’s Message
abstract: The league has looked for contrition in determining its discipline of players accused of conduct violations. Deshaun Watson’s insistence that he did nothing wrong undermined its attempt at rehabbing his image.

multimedia.caption: “I’ve always stood on my innocence and always said I’ve never assaulted anyone or disrespected anyone, and I’m continuing to stand on that,” Deshaun Watson said Thursday after his 11-game suspension was announced.

“I’ve always stood on my innocence and always said I’ve never assaulted anyone or disrespected anyone, and I’m continuing to stand on that,” Deshaun Watson said Thursday after his 11-game suspension was announced.

title: Manchester United and the Mounting Cost of Failure
abstract: The problem at United is not, and never has been, a lack of money. It is the lack of a plan.

title: After 19 Years of ‘Managing,’ He Finally Gets to Be a Manager
abstract: When Yadier Molina’s playing career ends this fall, he’ll head to Venezuela to coach. His qualifications? “I’ve managed for 19 years in the big leagues.”

title: Sylvia Fowles Wants to See Who She Can Be Without Basketball

title: Watson Suspended 11 Games and Fined $5 Million in Sexual Misconduct Case
abstract: The N.F.L. was seeking a yearlong suspension but reached a settlement with the quarterback after an arbitrator recommended a six-game penalty.

title: ‘There Is No Football Family’: Broken Contracts Mar Soccer’s Return in Ukraine
abstract: European soccer offered support to Ukrainian teams when Russia invaded the country. Now, as rivals bargain shop in wartime, one top club says the sense of solidarity is gone.

multimedia.caption: The heavyweight champion Oleksandr Usyk of Ukraine during the weigh-in ceremony in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, on Friday. His rematch with Anthony Joshua was delayed after the Russian invasion of Ukraine and a stint in the Ukrainian army.

title: Gene LeBell, 89, Judo Champion, Wrestler and Star Stuntman, Dies
abstract: A tough guy who got beaten up by the likes of John Wayne, he had a bottom-line view of his job: “The more you get hit in the nose, the richer you are.”

multimedia.caption: The Hollywood stuntman Gene LeBell in the 1950s, when he was a professional wrestler. He had earlier been an American Amateur Union judo champion.

title: Usyk and Joshua to Resettle Heavyweight Picture With Saudi Arabia as Backdrop
abstract: Oleksandr Usyk surprised the boxing world when he upset Anthony Joshua in their first bout. Then, Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and maneuvering within boxing led to a rematch in Saudi Arabia.

multimedia.caption: The rematch between Oleksandr Usyk and Anthony Joshua is scheduled for Saturday night at the Jeddah Superdome, a 35,000-seat multipurpose sports arena in Saudi Arabia.

title: Yaqub Talib, Brother of Former N.F.L. Star, Killed Youth Coach, Police Say
abstract: He is accused of fatally shooting the coach after an argument at a game in Lancaster, Texas, the police said. His brother, the retired Super Bowl champion Aqib Talib, was also there, a witness said.

title: A Reporter Went Down the Brewers’ Slide. He Broke a Wrist and Cracked 6 Ribs.
abstract: The Milwaukee mascot rides the slide for Brewer home runs. David Vassegh had highly anticipated his turn, but it ended in a less celebratory mood.

multimedia.caption: David Vassegh, a Dodgers reporter for SportsNet LA, wore a cast on his right wrist Thursday after breaking it Wednesday.

title: Manchester United Isn’t for Sale, but a Piece of It Might Be
abstract: The Glazer family isn’t soliciting bids for United. But selling a minority stake in the team could set the price for all of it.

abstract: The agreement splits the Big Ten’s sports among Fox, NBC and CBS, and is the richest annual deal for any college sports league.
